result.execSummary:
The defendant Pedy J Page-Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund packet

Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

Court ordered defendant to serve 117 days in the House of Correction, with 117 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 10/03/2017.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Pedy J Page-Robinson in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Defendant Pedy J Page-Robinson in custody.  Daniel Murphy for Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Pedy J Page-Robinson not in court, in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defense attorney is in jury trial in another branch.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
